claim: only 2 team have be both the home team and visit team
resp:
Here are the steps to evaluate the claim:

1. Identify the column names in the table that correspond to the home team and the visiting team. In this case, the relevant columns are "designated visitors" (visiting team) and "designated home" (home team).
2. Go through each row of the data to see if any teams appear in both columns as either the home or visiting team. This would indicate that a single team has been both home and away in the same season.
3. If no such instances are found, then it can be concluded that only 2 teams have been both the home and visiting team, as there are only two distinct roles (home and away) for any given game.
4. If instances are found where a single team appears in both columns of a row, then it would mean that more than 2 teams have been both home and visiting. In this case, no such instances were found.

Final answer:
{
  "chain_of_thought": [

    "Check each row to see if a team appears in both columns",
    "If no such instances are found, then only 2 teams have been both home and visiting"

  "relevant_cells": []
}

claim: the nfl international series most often take place within the last 7 day of october
resp:
Here are the steps to analyze the claim:

1. Identify the table columns that might be relevant for our analysis. In this case, we need to focus on the "year" and "date". The rest of the columns (stadium, city, television, designated visitors, designated home) are not necessary for our analysis since they do not provide information about when the game took place.

2. Check whether all entries have a date in October. In this table, all entries except one have an October date, so we can assume that most NFL International Series games happen in October.

3. If all the games are in October, we need to find out if there is a pattern regarding when in October these games take place. To do this, compare each game's date with the last 7 days of October and see if they match.

4. In this table, only two entries have dates that fall within the last 7 days of October: rows 3 (2009) and 13 (2016). Comparing these entries to the other games in the table, we don't find a clear pattern regarding if most NFL International Series take place within the last 7 days of October.

Final Answer:

  "chain_of_thought": [

claim: teh new england patriot have be the designated vistors the least number of time
the jacksonvill jaguar have be the desginated visitor the greatest number of time
resp:
Here are the steps to determine whether the claim is true or false:

1. First, we need to find out how many times the Jacksonville Jaguars have been designated visitors in the given table. We will look at the "designated visitors" column for each row where the value of the "city" column is "london", since all games listed are played in London.

2. Count the number of times the value "Jacksonville Jaguars" appears in the "designated visitors" column for rows with "London" as city. From the given table, it appears three times: 2013 (row 7), 2014 (row 10 and row 11).

3. Now that we have found the number of times the Jaguars were designated visitors (which is 3 in this case), compare that to the number of times any other team was designated as a visitor in London during the same period. From the table, we see that every team listed played in London as a designated visitor at least once with the exception of the Dallas Cowboys and Detroit Lions. The Cowboys were only scheduled for 2014 but did not play (row 13), and the Lions played in 2014 but also didn't appear on any games (row 9). All other teams had at least one game as a designated visitor in London more than once.

4. Since the Jacksonville Jaguars have been designated visitors the greatest number of times among all the listed NFL teams, our claim is true.

Final Answer:
{
  "chain_of_thought": [
    "Identify the team (Jacksonville Jaguars) and city (London) from the claim.",
    "Count the occurrences of the team being designated visitors in London.",
    "Compare the count to the number of occurrences for other teams as designated visitors in London.",

}
